#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk cronie
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: cronie bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The cronie packages contain the standard UNIX daemon crond that runs specified programs at scheduled times and related tools. They are a fork of the original vixie-cron cron implementation and have security and configuration enhancements like the ability to use pam and SELinux. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the file 0hourly was not marked as a configuration file in the cronie spec file. Consequently, system administrators were not able to change in which minute of the hour shall hourly tasks be executed. To fix this bug, 0hourly has been marked as a configuration file, and it is now possible to modify the time of hourly tasks execution. (BZ#1083114) Prior to this update, cron jobs of users whose account information was acquired from the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server might not run after the system boot, and the "bad username" error was logged. The handling of accounts that are temporarily missing from the system due to loss of contact with the LDAP server has been improved with a patch, and the error no longer occurs in this situation. (BZ#1145080) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: The crond daemon now logs shutdowns. Its proper terminations are therefore distinguishable from abnormal ones. (BZ#1207096) Users of cronie are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
